Yesterday, @RepKinzinger and I introduced the Network Security Information Sharing Act, which would develop a program to facilitate information sharing between the federal government and companies regarding threats to our cyber networks.  https://go.usa.gov/xVv34¬†

Protecting our cybersecurity requires cooperation between the federal government and private sector. One of the most effective steps we can take to prevent cyberattacks is to work closely with the communications sector to eliminate backdoors and supply chain risks.

I just introduced H.R. 4462, the SHARE Act, with @BobLatta to establish a program which explores new ways for the federal government to share its spectrum and put it to the best possible use. #SHAREact  https://go.usa.gov/xVdtN¬†

Spectrum ‚Äì the airwaves which carry phone calls, Wi-Fi, broadcast radio, and television ‚Äì is limited, and demand for it is highly competitive. We must ensure the federal government is using its spectrum to maximize innovation and benefits for all Americans.

The House just passed H.R. 1423, the FAIR Act, to prohibit mandatory arbitration clauses and restore the rights of consumers and workers to sue. This is a significant victory for workers who face racial discrimination, sexual harassment, or workplace rights violations.

You shouldn't have to sign away your right to a fair trial in order to get a job, but corporate contracts often force consumers and employees to settle disputes in private arbitration. This process favors corporations - no judge or jury - and consumers and workers have no choice.
